type.title: Short Title.
type.context: PUBLIC NOTARIES ACT under Short Title. 1.  This Act may be cited as the Public Notaries Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Public Notaries Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Appointment of public notary.
type.context: PUBLIC NOTARIES ACT under Appointment of public notary.  2.  (1) The President may by warrant under his hand and seal appoint a legal practitioner of not less than ten years standing to be a public notary, hereinafter referred to as a notary.  (2) Notaries may be appointed for Guyana or for any of the counties of Demerara, Essequibo or Berbice. LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 4:02 Public Notaries   L.R.O. 1/2012      Oath to be taken by notary. type.name: section
type.title: Oath to be taken by notary.
type.context: PUBLIC NOTARIES ACT under Oath to be taken by notary. 3.  A notary before being admitted to and entering on the duties of his office shall take and subscribe the oath set out in the Schedule before such person as the President shall appoint generally or specially.
type.description: A notary before being admitted to and entering on the duties of his office shall take and subscribe the oath set out in the Schedule before such person as the President shall appoint generally or specially.

type.name: section
type.title: Register to be kept.
type.context: PUBLIC NOTARIES ACT under Register to be kept. 4. The Registrar of the Supreme Court shall keep a register in which he shall enter the name of every person who shall be appointed and admitted to the office of notary and the date of his appointment and admission.
type.description: The Registrar of the Supreme Court shall keep a register in which he shall enter the name of every person who shall be appointed and admitted to the office of notary and the date of his appointment and admission.

type.name: section
type.title: Fees not to be in excess of those prescribed.
type.context: PUBLIC NOTARIES ACT under Fees not to be in excess of those prescribed. 5. A notary shall not charge for the performance of any of the duties of his office any sum in excess of the fee which is prescribed or fixed by rules of court under the High Court Act or under any other Act.
type.description: A notary shall not charge for the performance of any of the duties of his office any sum in excess of the fee which is prescribed or fixed by rules of court under the High Court Act or under any other Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Proceedings in case of misconduct of notary.
type.context: PUBLIC NOTARIES ACT under Proceedings in case of misconduct of notary. 6. (1) If a notary shall be convicted of any offence, or be adjudged guilty of any misconduct whether in his capacity of notary or otherwise, the court before which he is so convicted or by which he is so adjudged shall make a report thereof to the President, the President may revoke his warrant of appointment and direct the Registrar to remove the name of the notary from the register.   (2) If any person shall make a complaint on oath charging a notary with misconduct in his office the President may appoint a fit and proper person to inquire into the facts and report thereon to the President and if the President is of opinion that the notary has been guilty of misconduct he may suspend him from practice for a specified time or revoke his warrant of appointment and direct the Registrar to remove his name from the register.   (3) When a notary has been suspended from LAWS OF GUYANA Public Notaries Cap. 4:02 5  L.R.O. 1/2012           Offences. [6 of 1997]           s. 3 practice or the Registrar in pursuance of a direction by the President removes the name of a notary from the register he shall cause notice of the fact to be published in the Gazette.   (4) Every complaint charging a notary with misconduct shall contain a statement of the material facts on which the person complaining relies.
